Home / Interviews / Interviews by Conference / GOTO Conference 2014

GOTO Conference 2014

GOTO Conference 2014 brings together 17 interviews from 2014. Recurring themes include community building and user-group organizing, conference speaking and presentation skills, and Ruby and Rails practice. Featured interviewees include Adrian Cockcroft, Aino Vonge Corry, Alex Rutkowski, and Camille Fournier.

  • Coverage: 17 interviews from 2014.
  • Featured interviewees: Adrian Cockcroft, Aino Vonge Corry, Alex Rutkowski, Camille Fournier, and Cindy Sprague.
  • Common themes: community building and user-group organizing, conference speaking and presentation skills, Ruby and Rails practice, DevOps culture at GOTO Chicago 2014, and Mixing Lean & Agile Development at GOTO Chicago 2014.

Trusted Sources

Notable Contributors

  • Adrian Cockcroft — Former cloud architecture leader at Netflix. Focus: Cloud operations at scale, resilience, and DevOps transformation. Interview

Interview with Adrian Cockcroft keynote speaker for GOTO Chicago 2014
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Adrian Cockcroft
Topic: conference speaking and presentation skills
Uploaded: Apr 29, 2022
Conference: GOTO Conference 2014
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview adrian-cockcroft conference goto-conference goto-conference-2014 open-source conference-speaking-and-presentation-skills
Video description: Adrian Cockcroft gave a keynote speech at GOTO Chicago 2014. In his talk, he discussed the importance of speed in innovation and how disruptions in industries often occur when an incumbent company makes assumptions about certain things being expensive or hard to do, only for a disrupter to come along and take advantage of those things becoming cheap and easy. Cockcroft used examples such as open source software and solid state disk storage to illustrate his points. He also talked about the shift in the software industry from traditional enterprise companies to end users being the source of the best, most reliable software.
